00046 class InterpolatorIterator : public AbstractIterator<m_value_type>
00047 {
00048   //private:
00049 protected:
00055     class Entry 
00056     {
00057         public:
00066         Entry(m_time_type t_from, m_time_type t_to, m_value_type v_from, m_value_type v_to, m_sample_count_type steps)
00067             :t_from_(t_from), t_to_(t_to), v_from_(v_from), v_to_(v_to), steps_(steps) {}
00069         m_time_type t_from_;
00071         m_time_type t_to_;
00073         m_value_type v_from_;
00075         m_value_type v_to_;
00077         m_sample_count_type steps_;
00078     };
00079 
00083     list<Entry> queue_;
00084 
00089     m_sample_count_type stepsLeft_;
00090     
00094     m_value_type value_;
00095 
00099     m_value_type delta_;
00100 
00101 public:
00102     
00106     InterpolatorIterator();
00107     
00108     // no dynamic data, so destructor, copy constructor,
00109     // and assignment operator are not needed.
00110 
00111     // C R E A T I O N  F U N C T I O N S
00112     
00123     void append(m_time_type t_from, m_time_type t_to, m_value_type v_from, m_value_type v_to, m_sample_count_type steps);
00124     
00125     // A B S T R A C T   I T E R A T O R   F U N C T I O N S
00126 
00131     virtual InterpolatorIterator* clone() = 0;
00132     
00138     bool hasNext();
00139     
00144     virtual m_value_type& next() = 0;
00145     
00146 };
